item.title: Daniel (Attack of the Books!) add a quote by Joss Whedon
item.description: "I write to give myself strength. I write to be the characters that I am not. I write to explore all the things I'm afraid of. " -- Joss Whedon

item.title: Daniel (Attack of the Books!) add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Daniel (Attack of the Books!) add a quote by Marianne Williamson
item.description: "Children are happy because they don't have a file in their minds called "All the Things That Could Go Wrong." -- Marianne Williamson

item.title: Daniel (Attack of the Books!) add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "War is peace. Freedom is slavery. Ignorance is strength." -- George Orwell

item.title: Daniel (Attack of the Books!) add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "The question isn't who is going to let me; it's who is going to stop me." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Daniel (Attack of the Books!) add a quote by E.L. Doctorow
item.description: "Writing is a socially acceptable form of schizophrenia." -- E.L. Doctorow

item.title: Daniel (Attack of the Books!) add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "If you want to know what a man's like, take a good look at how he treats his inferiors, not his equals." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Daniel (Attack of the Books!) add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Clothes make the man. Naked people have little or no influence on society." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Daniel (Attack of the Books!) add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Daniel (Attack of the Books!) add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Daniel (Attack of the Books!) add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Daniel (Attack of the Books!) add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Daniel (Attack of the Books!) add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Daniel (Attack of the Books!) add a quote by Arthur Schopenhauer
item.description: "Talent hits a target no one else can hit. Genius hits a target no one else can see." -- Arthur Schopenhauer

item.title: Daniel (Attack of the Books!) add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "A day without sunshine is like, you know, night." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Daniel (Attack of the Books!) add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Daniel (Attack of the Books!) add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "If you cannot read all your books...fondle them---peer into them, let them fall open where they will, read from the first sentence that arrests the eye, set them back on the shelves with your own hands, arrange them on your own plan so that you at least know where they are. Let them be your friends; let them, at any rate, be your acquaintances." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Daniel (Attack of the Books!) add a quote by Steven Erikson
item.description: "There is no struggle too vast, no odds too overwhelming, for even should we fail - should we fall - we will know that we have lived." -- Steven Erikson

item.title: Daniel (Attack of the Books!) add a quote by Dave Barry
item.description: "The one thing that unites all human beings, regardless of age, gender, religion, economic status, or ethnic background, is that, deep down inside, we all believe that we are above-average drivers." -- Dave Barry

item.title: Daniel (Attack of the Books!) add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "Never ruin an apology with an excuse." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Daniel (Attack of the Books!) add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Since it is so likely that they will meet cruel enemies, let them at least have heard of brave knights and heroic courage. . . Let there be wicked kings and beheadings, battles and dungeons, giants and dragons, and let villains be soundly killed at the end of the book." -- C.S. Lewis
